-- Anachronox --

Anachronox grins ferociously. Well, grinning is not quite the word, 
it's more the sense that he's grinning that anything with the way 
his head is designed. "Ugly or no; All will fall to the 
Tripredacus." He clenches his speargun in anticipation. "So we are 
to wait until fired on to attack the first enemies we see correct?" 
He prepares for vanguard launch.


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Daemos received a transmission from the Shadow Destiny.
> 
> Daemos: Yes, Tankor, What is it?
> 
> Tankor's voice came in low: Sir, Predacon commander Shivah 
contacted 
> us for a pact. I checked the origin of the transmission and it 
> concorded with the base where you are heading. I suggested they 
would 
> meet you there.
> 
> Daemos: You have what? What if their intentions are hostiles? They 
> will have time to get ready for a forceful defense and we could 
suffer 
> great casualties! You idiot!
> 
> He thought for a minute. Tankor's silence revealed his great 
> embarassment.
> 
> Daemos: On the other hand... If they truly wish to work with us... 
> This could make things easier... Hellgate over and out.
> 
> He thought. This operation was going to be either easier than 
> expected, or a total butchery. The homeworlds could not wait... He 
had 
> to go on.
> 
> Daemos: Jetstorm, Anachronox, get ready for vanguard drop. I have 
had 
> new data. Expect either great resistance or no resistance at all. 
> There could be a group of bots wishing to discuss. That's where 
the 
> prophets will come in play. As soon as you three drop, you form 
> Prophetus and lead negotiations. The vanguard drop is in 5 cycles. 
> Understood.
> 
> The Prophets looked at each other, worried, excited, thoughtful, 
but 
> nonetheless decided to live up to their name.
> 
> Belthassan: We are ready, Daemos.
> 
> Jetstorm: Anachronox, I want to pick the small and many ones. I 
leave 
> the big ugly ones to you, okay?
